vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀπο-φθέγγομαι,
speak one's opinion plainly, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; utter an apophthegm, [Refs 1st c.BC+]: metaphorically of vessels when struck, ring, σαπρὸν ἀ.[Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II chant hymns, [Refs]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to say, speak out, address, declare, in some contexts with the inference of urgency or boldness
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to say, speak out, address, declare, in some contexts with the inference of urgency or boldness
to speak out, declare, address particularly solemn, weighty, or pithy sayings, Acts 2:4, 14; 26:25*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: hablar, declarar; dirigirse a (se usa generalmente en relación con una elocución inspirada)
